article:
The 'ColumbusMan-Tended Free Flyer' (MTFF) was a European Space Agency (ESA)
program to develop a space station that could be used for a variety of
microgravity experiments while serving ESA's needs for an autonomous manned
space platform (for an image, see
[http://www.astronautix.com/graphics/m/mtffhst.jpg here]). The program ran from
1986 to 1991, was expected to cost $3.56 billion including launch and
utilization, and was cancelled while still in the
planning stage. Aspects of the program were later realised in the ''Columbus''
science laboratory attached to the International Space Station (ISS).
